meanings.definition: Negligent or careless in performing one's duty
meanings.sent1: She was remiss in completing her homework on time.
meanings.sent2: It is remiss of him to ignore his responsibilities at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat was remiss in its duty to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun, remiss in its duty, failed to shine on the rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was remiss in grading the students' assignments, causing confusion.

meanings.definition: Failing to fulfill one's obligations or duties
meanings.sent1: He was remiss in paying his bills, leading to late fees.
meanings.sent2: It is remiss of her to forget her friend's birthday.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful squirrel was remiss in gathering nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: The clock, remiss in its ticking, caused confusion in the household.
meanings.sent5: The remiss employee forgot to submit the important report, causing delays.

meanings.definition: Lacking in care or attention to detail
meanings.sent1: She was remiss in checking the accuracy of her calculations.
meanings.sent2: It is remiss of him to overlook the typos in the document.
meanings.sent3: The lazy bee was remiss in collecting pollen for the hive.
meanings.sent4: The painter, remiss in his strokes, left gaps in the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The remiss student forgot to proofread his essay, resulting in errors.
